dbreport 0.0.0.9010
  • Reference

Create reports of a table

Source: R/dbreport.R
dbreport.Rd

Create reports from data base tables, R table objects (data.table, data.frame, tibble)

dbreport(
  con = NULL,
  schema = NULL,
  tbl = NULL,
  col = NULL,
  entry = NULL,
  title = "My report title",
  text = NULL,
  plot_distinct = TRUE,
  plot_type = c("lollipop", "bar_horiz", "treemap"),
  plot_limit = 40L,
  output_dir = NULL,
  output_file = "report",
  output_format = c("html_document", "html_vignette", "pdf_document", "word_document"),
  file = TRUE,
  file_format = c("csv", "json"),
  file_type = c("single", "multiple"),
  exit = TRUE,
  verbose = FALSE
)

Arguments

con

Connection to data base, R-object (data.table, data.frame, tibble). Required.
schema

Data base schema (if applicable).
tbl

Table to be used for summary report (if applicable).
col

Table columns that should be summarised in report.
entry

Table entries which should be comsidered in summary report.
title

Title of summary report.
text

User defined text input to add some description to the report. Default NULL - no text. Can be a character vector or a file.
plot_distinct

Include plots of ordered distinct counts of each column in summary report.
plot_type

Should a lollipop or a treemap plot be produced?
plot_limit

Limit distinct count axis in the plots. Default: 100L. Should be set to a reasonable size.
output_dir

To which directory should the output be saved?
output_file

File name
output_format

Which markdown output_format should be used for rendering the summary report? E.g. html_document, html_vignette, pdf_document, ...
file

Should one or multiple files for each distinct column counts br created?
file_format

To which format should the file(s) be put out (csv, json). Multiple possible.
file_type

Output each column distinct counts set to a single or to multiple files.
exit

logical. Should database connections be closed after runing dbreport(). Default: TRUE.
verbose

TODO

Value

The function creates a markdown report and exports files

Examples

# \donttest{
# creates a .html, .pdf, .doc via Rmarkdown
dbreport(con = iris,
         plot_distinct = TRUE,
         plot_type = 'lollipop',
         plot_limit = 10, # Limit your plot to the first 15 entries
         output_dir = file.path(tempdir(), 'iris'),
         output_file = 'test',
         output_format = 'pdf_document', # you can also create a .pdf
         title = 'My iris report',
         file = TRUE, # Output single distinct counts to a file
         file_type = 'multiple',
         file_format = 'csv')
#>
